page.title: 12PORTHCAWL-Transport
page.content: Great changes have occurred in transport systems during the past 20years.There has been a major swing from public to private transport.The train which once brought day tourists to Porthcawl by the hundred,no longer runs,no traces of the line or station remain.Large numbers of private cars now arrive causing severe problems at the end of the day as they pour out of the town.Coaches bring large numbers of day tourists and ranks of them can be seen parked near Coney Beach.The number of vehicles coming into town causes much congestion.Large areas of what was once the harbour are now car and coach parks.The volume of traffic in and around the town makes it difficult for tourists and residents to shop and move around without extreme caution in the summer months.
